decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. It utilizes powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Murktide Regent to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color strategy while also including utility lands like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a game of resource management.

The main idea behind this deck is to aggressively use artifacts and blue mana sources to quickly generate mana and card advantage. By combining artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal with powerful cards such as Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, this deck can overwhelm opponents with a combination of artifact creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will helps protect the deck's key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the aggressive artifact strategy to shine.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost lands to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It also includes a variety of control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main goal is to generate massive amounts of colorless mana to cast game-ending threats and control the board with powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Disruptor Flute. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful ramp and control elements, leading to victory through sheer power and disruption.

This deck revolves around assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It uses cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also utilizing Orcish Bowmasters and Street Wraith for additional pressure. Thassa's Oracle is the primary win condition alongside Doomsday, with Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal providing the necessary mana acceleration to execute the combo. Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thoughtseize help to dig for key pieces, while Force of Will and Daze protect the combo from disruption. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and flexibility.

The deck revolves around using Cephalid Illusionist to mill cards from your library, then using cards like Nomads en-Kor to put Narcomoebas into play. By combining these creatures with cards like Dread Return or Thassa's Oracle, you can win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Cards like Urza's Saga provide additional utility and consistency to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, while utilizing creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp to apply pressure and control the board. It also aims to utilize powerful equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Trailblazer's Torch to quickly close out the game. The deck's mana denial strategy is reinforced with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, creating a strong aggro Death & Taxes archetype that aims to overwhelm the opponent while maintaining control over the game.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through disruption and removal while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing cheap counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, along with hand disruption like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Creatures like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide aggression and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing key cards. Overall, the deck aims to establish tempo and control the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo, using cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Dark Ritual to set up a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. It also includes protection with Force of Will and Daze, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently find and execute the Doomsday combo to win the game before the opponent can respond effectively. The inclusion of various lands and mana acceleration cards helps to ensure the combo can be executed as quickly as possible.

The focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator, allowing for explosive plays with high-cost spells like Kozilek's Command and The One Ring. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game while setting up its powerful combos. The inclusion of cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Waterlogged Teachings provide additional utility and card advantage, creating a versatile and challenging deck to play against in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence using artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards such as Urza's Saga, Chalice of the Void, and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to control the battlefield while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Pinnacle Emissary provide card advantage and utility, allowing for efficient plays and maximizing the deck's potential. With a mixture of disruption and powerful artifact creatures, this deck seeks to dominate the game early on and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with mana dorks and using powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Collector Ouphe to control the game. The key strategy is to generate mana efficiently with Gaea's Cradle and Natural Order to cheat out threats and win the game quickly. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures, disruptive spells, and efficient mana generation, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Library, and Green Sun's Zenith to find the necessary pieces quickly. It also includes cards like Mox Diamond and Knight of the Reliquary for mana acceleration and additional utility. The deck includes various land-based interaction and protection cards like Thespian's Stage and Bojuka Bog to disrupt the opponent while working towards achieving the powerful combo win condition. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently combo off and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish control over the game by utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. The deck aims to lock down opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Trinisphere, allowing for a fast and decisive victory. The deck also includes burn spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption to finish off opponents and maintain dominance on the battlefield. Overall, this deck focuses on fast aggression and disruption to overwhelm opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent and control the game through mana disruption with Wasteland and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Obligator to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide helps to accelerate the deck's game plan and bring out larger threats ahead of schedule.

The deck focuses on using lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam to constantly search for and reuse powerful lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures to hinder opponent's strategies. The goal is to create a powerful board state while keeping the opponent's resources in check, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of land-based threats and disruption.

The main concept of this Legacy UR Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures and disruptive spells. Utilizing cheap creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence while controlling the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal with threats. The overall strategy is to be proactive and aggressive in order to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.
